intro: Senecio botijae, commonly known as the Botija Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptability to arid and nutrient-poor environments. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, forming a dense inflorescence that attracts pollinators. Senecio botijae is often found in open habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
